net.dean.jraw.http

Class RestRequest.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dean.jraw.http.RestRequest.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    RestRequest

    public static class RestRequest.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for creating new RestRequests

      • from

        public static RestRequest.Builder from(java.lang.String method,
                       java.net.URL url,
                       java.lang.Object... formArgs)
        Creates a new Builder that will result in a RestRequest whose URL will match the one given
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP verb
        url - The URL to parse
        formArgs - An optional array of Strings to send as form data
        Returns:
        A new Builder that represents the given URL

      • query

        public RestRequest.Builder query(java.lang.Object... args)
        Sets the query string arguments. The given parameters are passed into JrawUtils.args(Object...) and then given to query(java.util.Map).
        Parameters:
        args - The parameters that will be found in the query string
        Returns:

      • endpoint

        public RestRequest.Builder endpoint(Endpoints e,
                           java.lang.String... positionalUrlParams)
        Sets the endpoint to use. If the given endpoint has arguments in the URI (such as /user/{username}/about.json), then the given strings will be substituted in the order given. For example, if the endpoint was /api/multi/{multipath}/r/{srname}, and the given strings were "myMulti" and "mySubreddit", then the result would be /api/multipath/myMulti/mySubreddit. If path(String) is also called, this method will take priority, regardless of order.
        Parameters:
        e - The endpoint to use
        positionalUrlParams - The parameters to use. Must be equal to the size of the corresponding Endpoint's Endpoint.getUrlParams() list.
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • path

        public RestRequest.Builder path(java.lang.String path)
        Sets the path of the request. For example, "/stylesheet". If endpoint(net.dean.jraw.Endpoints, String...) is also called, that method will take priority, regardless of order.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to use
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • host

        public RestRequest.Builder host(java.lang.String host)
        Sets the request's host. For example, "www.reddit.com"
        Parameters:
        host - The new host
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • basicAuth

        public RestRequest.Builder basicAuth(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password)
        Sends this request with HTTP Basic Auth (see RFC 2617). HTTPS MUST be enabled, or else your passwords will be floating around the network in plain text. This method will automatically enable HTTPS.
        Returns:
        This Builder

      • build

        public RestRequest build()
        Builds this Builder into a fully-fledged RestRequest that mirrors the given parameters exactly
        Returns:
        A new RestRequest
